org.jacktheclipper.frontend.authentication

Class OrganizationGuard

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacktheclipper.frontend.authentication.OrganizationGuard

  • @Component
public class OrganizationGuard
extends java.lang.Object
    A class concerned with giving/ denying user's access to parts of the Jack the Clipper application. It adds checks concerning the organization names to the application. E. g. nobody can access /hansi/login if there is no OrganizationalUnit for which OrganizationalUnit.getName() returns "hansi".

    • Method Detail

      • isOwnOrganization

        public boolean isOwnOrganization(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                 java.lang.String accessedOrga)
        Compares the User.organization with the organization he is trying to access
        Parameters:
        authentication - The authentication holding the user. Normally of type CustomAuthenticationToken
        accessedOrga - The organization context the user is trying to access. If he was trying to access "/audi/feed/" this would be "audi".
        Returns:
        true if the organization does exist and matches the user's, false otherwise

      • isValidOrganization

        public boolean isValidOrganization(java.lang.String organization)
        Checks whether an organization does exist
        Parameters:
        organization - The name of the organization to check
        Returns:
        true if the organization exists, false otherwise

      • passwordOkay

        public boolean passwordOkay(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
        Checks whether a user has to change his password. It basically only delegates to AuthenticationUtils.isMustChangePassword(Authentication).
        Parameters:
        authentication -
        Returns:
        True if the user does not need to change his password, false otherwise
